intro: Zoegea mianensis, commonly known as the Mian Mountains zoegea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, adapting to the specific environmental conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are usually small and oval-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Zoegea mianensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
